items.doc: 93 Law of the People's Republic of China on Biosafety.txt
items.question: According to the relevant provisions of the Biosafety Law of the People's Republic of China, which of the following options is correct regarding the confidential management of biosafety information?
items.options: A. All biosafety information constitutes state secrets and must be strictly confidential; B. Only information concerning human genetic resources requires management under the State Secrets Protection Law; C. Where biosafety information constitutes state secrets, confidentiality management shall be implemented in accordance with the State Secrets Protection Law; D. Confidentiality management of biosafety information applies solely to the civilian sphere and not to the military domain.
items.user_answer: A. All biosafety information constitutes state secrets and must be strictly confidential

items.doc: 2 Anti-Monopoly Law of the People's Republic of China.txt
items.question: According to the provisions of the Anti-Monopoly Law concerning the declaration of business concentration, under which of the following circumstances may an operator be exempt from declaring the concentration to the State Council's anti-monopoly enforcement agency?
items.options: A. One of the undertakings involved in the concentration holds more than thirty per cent of the voting shares or assets of each other undertaking involved in the concentration; B. More than fifty per cent of the voting shares or assets of each undertaking involved in the concentration are held by the same undertaking not involved in the concentration; C. The documents and materials submitted by the undertakings are incomplete, but all materials are supplemented within the prescribed time limit; D. The State Council's anti-monopoly enforcement agency has not made a decision on whether to conduct further review within forty-five days of receiving the notification materials.
items.user_answer: C. The documents and materials submitted by the undertakings are incomplete, but all materials are supplemented within the prescribed time limit

items.doc: 121 Wool and Fur Fibre Quality Supervision and Management Measures.txt
items.question: According to China's wool fibre quality supervision system, which of the following options correctly describes the relationship between notarial inspection and supervisory inspection?
items.options: A. Notarised inspection applies to all varieties of pile fibres, while supervisory inspection applies only to pile fibres not subject to notarised inspection; B. Notarised inspection is conducted by specialised fibre inspection institutions, while supervisory inspection is conducted by fibre quality supervision institutions on pile fibres not subject to notarised inspection; C. Notarised inspection primarily examines quality and quantity, while supervisory inspection primarily examines packaging labelling; D. Notarised inspection is mandatory, while supervisory inspection is voluntary
items.user_answer: B. Notarised inspection is conducted by specialised fibre inspection institutions, while supervisory inspection is conducted by fibre quality supervision institutions on pile fibres not subject to notarised inspection

items.doc: 86 National Defence Mobilisation Law of the People's Republic of China.txt
items.question: According to relevant laws on national defence service, which of the following options correctly describes the age requirements for citizens undertaking national defence service?
items.options: A. All citizens aged eighteen or above shall perform national defence duties; B. The upper age limit for male citizens performing national defence duties is sixty years, and for female citizens fifty-five years; C. Female citizens shall still perform national defence duties during pregnancy and lactation; D. Professional technicians with specialised expertise are exempt from any age restrictions.
items.user_answer: D. Professional technicians with specialised expertise are exempt from any age restrictions.

items.doc: 86-Regulations on the Protection of Wild Plants.txt
items.question: According to China's relevant laws and regulations on the protection of wild plants, which of the following options correctly describes the management requirements for nationally key protected wild plants?
items.options: A. Foreign nationals may collect nationally protected wild plants within China's territory upon approval by the county-level administrative department for wild plants; B. The sale or purchase of nationally protected wild plants of Class II must be approved by the provincial-level administrative department for wild plants or its authorised agency; C. The export of nationally protected wild plants requires only an import-export permit issued by the State Administration for the Import and Export of Endangered Species; D. When collecting nationally protected wild plants, the quantity may be slightly exceeded beyond the permit's stipulated limit, but supplementary formalities must be completed afterwards.
items.user_answer: D. When collecting nationally protected wild plants, the quantity may be slightly exceeded beyond the permit's stipulated limit, but supplementary formalities must be completed afterwards.

items.doc: 21-Regulations on the Procedures for Formulating Rules.txt
items.question: According to China's relevant regulations on the administrative rule-making process, which of the following statements regarding the consultation procedure for draft regulations is correct?
items.options: A. The legal affairs department shall publish the draft regulations for public comment for no less than 30 days; B. Where the draft regulations involve significant adjustments to interests, a hearing must be held to solicit opinions; C. Where relevant departments have differing opinions on the draft regulations, the legal affairs department shall directly submit the matter to the department for decision; D. Where draft regulations concern grassroots interests, the legal affairs body may be exempted from conducting field investigations and research.
items.user_answer: D. Where draft regulations concern grassroots interests, the legal affairs body may be exempted from conducting field investigations and research.

items.doc: 29 Energy Conservation Law of the People's Republic of China.txt
items.question: According to the provisions on energy-saving technological advancement in the Energy Conservation Law of the People's Republic of China, which of the following options most accurately reflects the core responsibilities of the government in promoting energy-saving technological progress?
items.options: A. The government shall directly participate in the commercial development and market sales of energy-saving technologies; B. The government shall primarily guide and promote energy-saving technological advancement through formulating energy-saving technology policies, investing in scientific research funds, and organising demonstration projects; C. The government's primary duty is to mandate all enterprises and individuals to use designated energy-saving technologies and products; D. The government need only promote energy-saving technologies in rural areas, with urban areas being self-regulated by the market.
items.user_answer: A. The government shall directly participate in the commercial development and market sales of energy-saving technologies

items.doc: 237 Road Transport Safety Management Measures for Dangerous Goods.txt
items.question: According to relevant legal provisions on the supervision of hazardous chemical transport, which of the following penalty measures is correct for failure to monitor transport vehicles via the positioning system as required?
items.options: A. Directly impose a fine of 100,000 yuan; B. First issue a warning and order rectification; impose a fine only if rectification is refused; C. Impose a fine on the organisation only, without pursuing individual liability; D. The transport licence must be revoked simultaneously.
items.user_answer: B. First issue a warning and order rectification; impose a fine only if rectification is refused

items.doc: Measures for the Assessment of Measurement Standards.txt
items.question: According to the relevant regulations on measurement standard assessment, which of the following options correctly describes the procedures for handling the expiry of a measurement standard assessment certificate?
items.options: A. Three months prior to the expiry date, the certificate holder shall apply to the original assessment department for a review; B. If the review assessment is unsatisfactory, the assessment department shall directly cancel the original assessment certificate; C. If the validity period has expired, the applicant shall reapply for assessment as a newly established measurement standard; D. Should the re-assessment prove unsatisfactory, the certificate holder may apply for a reassessment within one month.
items.user_answer: C. If the validity period has expired, the applicant shall reapply for assessment as a newly established measurement standard

items.doc: Law of the People's Republic of China on Deputies to the National People's Congress and Local People's Congresses at All Levels.txt
items.question: According to China's Constitution and relevant laws, which of the following statements regarding the electoral rights of deputies to people's congresses at all levels is correct?
items.options: A. Deputies to the National People's Congress have the right to express opinions on the nominee for Director of the National Supervisory Commission proposed by the Presidium; B. Deputies to local people's congresses at or above the county level have the right to directly elect deputies to the people's congresses of the next higher level; C. Deputies to township people's congresses have the right to propose candidates for the president of the people's court at their level in accordance with legal procedures; D. Deputies to people's congresses at all levels may only cast votes in favour of or against confirmed candidates; they may not nominate alternative candidates.
items.user_answer: C. Deputies to township people's congresses have the right to propose candidates for the president of the people's court at their level in accordance with legal procedures
